Translation.Text: Direct tooth to tooth connection is not possible for connectors:
The placement is fine like this
Drag and drop tooth to tilt. Hold Ctrl to move.
Drag and drop tooth to tilt it along its axis
Drag and drop tooth in buccal, lingual, or occlusal direction
Inconsistent axis orientation. Please note that the scan data must be oriented either to Z or -Z axis.
It's OK that way, leave the gap
Use this option if there's no contact points in the physical articulator, either
The software will push upper- and lower jaw together
Additional spacing in occlusal direction that is applied everywhere
Additional spacing in occlusal direction that is only applied on top of the crown.
Additional horizontal spacing ( perpendicular to occlusal direction )

Could not generate lingual band. If the problem persists try again with a fresh offset coping without free-forming modifications. You can free-form again after this step.
Note that you can't edit an existing lingual band that has already been free-formed.
Reject current results to save scene in the project directory?
Select reference tooth for insertion dir.
There are intersections between upper- and lower jaw. How do you wish to deal with the situation?
Move upper and lower jaw apart along Z axis
Jaws will be moved apart until there is no more intersection
The incisial needle will no longer touch the incisal table
Any part of the pontic intersecting the gingiva will be cut away
The resulting restoration may not fit on the model
Stick all points to gingiva scan
Change the visualization of the Gingivathickness
Allow manual height-modification of the Protection
The Project will be closed, but the Software will remain open.
Combine all parts to one unit
Save merged waxup (selected for laser-melting) as
Close all holes in the selected part of the mesh. If no selection is present, close all holes in the mesh that are smaller than the size threshold (adjust by clicking drop-down arrow).
Tooth number for split was ambiguous. Please select tooth number of split

Use Ctrl+Click to copy profile from previously selected point to clicked point. Use Ctrl+Shift+Click to copy profile selected point to all points Use Shift+Click to copy profile from previosuly selected point to all points between
Load jaw movement data from file
The tooth bow could not be saved.
Measure distances, thickness and so on.
Please select material and implant type
Constructed parts will be saved into waiting queue. They can be nested later on.
Scans and contructions can be shown "sliced".
Select material block or create a new one
Show CNC path. Single path can be shown by clicking on the numbers (0 to ...) in the window.
Show distance to antagonist or to neighbour.
Immediately nest costructed parts. Automatically opens nesting software and load finished parts. At the same time they are saved into waiting queue.
Show/hide scan, tooth or constructed parts.
Load nesting files (.zzn) to elaborate them with the CAM software
Teeth will be adjusted to the situ model.
With this function the connectors (if already modeled) will be adjusted to the situ model.
By clicking the stop button, adjusting the situ model will be stopped.
Automatic recognition by setting one or more points.
Add one or more points to detect the margin more precisley
Recalculation of the preparation line in consideration of the defined points
The calculation of the preparation line will be stopped.
Define the margin point by point and confirm the definition with Accept drawing changes.
Draw a new line to extend or replace the old preparation line.
Recalculation of the preparation line in consideration of the defined points/lines.
Single points on the border can be shifted.
Single points on the border can be shifted only up and down.
Define value in millimeter for shifting.
Cuts intersections by the antagonist considering the anatomic distance
Cuts intersections by the neighbour teeth considering the anatomic distance.
Adjusts teeth considering anatomic distance to the neighbour teeth.

Dear customer,
in connection with the acquisition of our metal spindle, we would like to explicitly point out that Zirkonzahn shall assume no warranty/guarantee for damages to the device and/or other parts, if any other consumables than those originally produced and sold by Zirkonzahn (especially full metal disks, burs) are being used.
Especially with metal, the degree of hardness of the full metal disks is tuned to the metal burs and the device. Only when using original consumables, the metal spindle produces the desired results.
For these reasons, we do not accept any claims for warranty/guarantee and damage compensation of any type, if non-original consumables and/or spare parts are being used.
In this regard, we refer explicitly to the instructions of use, which include further important information for operation of our devices.
Please contact our Sales department, if you have any queries or require further clarification.
Zirkonzahn GmbH

Scale directions: - No key: along main axis - Shift: uniform in all directions - Ctrl: uniform parallel to main axis (keep length fixed) - Ctrl+Shift: freely in mouse direction Hint: Right click this button resets current scaling.
Nesting Module is deactivated in DEMO Version.
Modify reconstuction type / for example healthy tooth -> missing tooth / anatomic -> reduced)
Put one scan / reconstuction over another (e.g. with articulator overview scan)
Open calculation tool for ideal connector's cross section
Define the distance between preparation margin and start of cement gap
Define the incisal/occlusal area to be without cement gap
Increase the margin's thickness in horizontal direction
Lenght of the angled crown margin
Rise of the angled crown margin
Amplification of the crown margin in vertical direction
Angle, with which the undercuts should be blocked out
Width of the area which is excluded from outblocking
Apply the crown's insertion direction onto the die
Increase critical areas (smaller than 1mm) onto the dies
Define tool diameter (you should put 1,05 mm because the crown's inside will be milled with the 1L tool)
Define additional spacing in occlusal direction between die and crown
Define additional spacing in X-axes between die and crown
Modify the default colour of scans and eventually reconstructions
Define additional spacing in Y-axes between die and crown
Apply the current view as insertion direction for the selected crown/s
Preserves as much as possible the tooth's shape during the adaption process to the die: (8 = preserve as much shape as possible... 1 = no preservation)
Define the pontic's distance to gingiva
Apply pontic's adaptation onto the gingiva
Material thickness taken away by shrinking
Adjust how much less to shrink lingually
Mark the lingual band all around the tooth
Mark the lingual band only onto the lingual/palatinal side
Modify the connector's shape (left mouse onto the connector's control points and move them by mouse)
Show/don't show numerical value of cross section, height and width
Open the calculation tool for connectors
Distance between set and closesed point vertically from surface)
Show intersections/distances as well onto the healthy teeth
Modify the scaling of intersection-indicator Rightclick to set the actual value as default
Define the interval for automatic saving in minutes
Turn on/off the illumination to the modellation
Set the first point onto the mobile scan
Set the second point onto the fixed scan
Put the mobile scan over the fixed one
Calculate the best common position of both scans
Removes all points from the scans
Move situation model freely - Ctrl: rotate situation model
Apply current view al screw-channel direction
Set screw-channel in direction of automatically detected Z-axis
Define or modify top of abutments
Define or modify bottom of abutments / emergence profile
Activate/deactivate "Show distance to gingiva in colour"
Apply current view as insertion direction for primary telescope
Modify height of attachment (to start from the center of the attachment)
Apply current view as insertion direction for attachments
Set distance of attachment to gingiva
The short cut is in use by "{0}". Use short cut anyway?
To activate the various libraries of the Heroes Collection or to obtain further information, your sales partner is at your disposal.
Attention, the Oralscanningprogram is already running. Please close the running instance before launching it again.
Use arrow key to change view position

Activate Superfunctions: Ctrl + click with the left mouse button: a small window opens in the background with options for changing the anatomy Shift + right mouse button – Brush Selection (Default, Cylinder, Tip) Ctrl + right mouse button - Action-Selection (Smooth, add/remove Material) Ctrl + MouseWheel - change brush strength Shift+ MouseWheel - change brush size
The Project and the Software will be closed.
Would you like to close the project or the Software?
Changes in the orientation will be applied.
Changes in the Scandata-Orientation will be ignored
Align to original scan data files but apply jaw movement.
Changes to the orientation will be applied. The jaw-movement will be applied.
This will clear the entire margin and start from scratch.
We have found Zirkonzahn Interfaces. Would you like to perform mechanical retentions?
Show Distance/Intersection to antagonist in colors (mm)
Use mouse to place tooth model.
(move tooth model with pressed left mouse button)
(scale tooth model with shift and left mouse button pressed)
(rotate tooth model with ctrl and left mouse button pressed)
(move connector with pressed left mouse button)
(move connector with shift and left mouse button pressed)
(move docking point with ctrl and left mouse button pressed)
Selects only visible Surfaces, but no hidden or covered surfaces
Selects all areas, also hidden or covered surfaces
By click on the surface you select everything that is connected to the click point.
Adjust Connector dimension by cross section
Set Connector by width and height
Change height of the Lingual Band
Start Movement-Simulation for the actual Scan
Preview of the selected tooth model: {0}
Insertion direction cannot be applied to the current Scene. Maybe a tooth is selected or insertion direction is not appliable for this Reconstruction.
The necessary Help-Files were not found.
Set info point (Dbl click to fix it)
Set individual parameters for provisional crown. Choose a tooth above.
Material thickness of the provisional crown
Angle of the peripheral stump surface to the horizontal plane (=insertion direction)
Border angle to the horizontal plane
Same insertion direction for each crown
Create crown bottom in consideration of parameter settings
Hint: Please choose now how to proceed and press 'Continue'
Focus point on arrowhead with mouse and keep left mouse button pressed while moving the mouse arrow.
F10: Fullscreen on/off F11: Close Wizard
Focus area with mouse and keep left mouse button pressed while moving the mouse arrow.
Focus area with mouse and keep left mouse button + "Shift" pressed while moving the mouse arrow.
Focus profile border with mouse, then keep "Ctrl" pressed and click left mouse button.
Focus point with mouse, keep left mouse button pressed and click right mouse button.
Focus point/arrow with mouse and keep left mouse pressed while moving the mouse arrow.
Focus point/arrow with mouse and keep left mouse button + "Ctrl" pressed while moving the mouse arrow.
Focus point/arrow with mouse, then keep left mouse button + "Shift" pressed while moving the mouse arrow.
Check for maximal gingiva. Uncheck to allow any distance to gingiva.
Check to enforce maximal penetration depth. Uncheck to allow any penetration with gingiva.
Keep "Shift" button pressed and double click left mouse button.
Define the contact point on the mesial healthy tooth.
Define the contact point on the distal healthy tooth.
Change form and position of tooth.
Focus tooth with mouse and keep left mouse button pressed while moving the mouse.
Focus tooth with mouse and keep left mouse button + "Ctrl" pressed while moving the mouse.
Focus tooth with mouse and keep left mouse button + "Shift" pressed while moving the mouse.
Focus tooth with mouse and keep left mouse button and "Ctrl" + "Shift" pressed while moving the mouse.
Select the material you want to mill
Would you like to order it in our webshop?
Open the Zirkonzahn.Webshop and add the Parts to the Basket
Do not order and continue with Zirkonzahn.Modellier
No and don't ask me again
Do not order, continue with Zirkonzahn.Modellier and save my decision.
The project name will be changed to the name of the scene file
Note that previously saved files may be overwritten
Do you really want to convert the bite splint to a waxup? Warning: This operation cannot be reversed or undone. Hint: You should save a scene file, before executing this operation
Assuming that margin line is subgingival or very hard to see.
Assuming that margin line is good to detect (e.g. undercut preparation)
Snap drawn line to scan data?
Align drawn curve along scan data feature lines for semi-automatic detection? Hint: If activated, you can still draw freely by holding CTRL-Key.
Warning, antagonist data was modified to remove intrusions of {0} mm.
Warning, antagonist intrusions of {0} mm could not be completely removed.

Due to scan data inaccuracies, there is an intersection between upper- and lower jaw with at least {0} mm.
To allow the virtual articulator to work correctly, the scan data must not intersect.
Warning, antagonist intrusions of {0} mm could only be removed to {1}.
Error: Scan data does intersect antagonist with at least {0} mm but the automatic removal in the software failed.

The file that you are trying to load is encrypted with an unknown key. You probably received it from a scanner or from CAD/CAM System that is not an 'open system'. Please try to convert this file to an 'open file format' manually.
Use designed model instead of original scan data for articulator simulation?
Distance between upper- and lower jaw:
The scan data will be deformed to resolve the situation
If you start the articulator, you will be prompted again
The intersection between upper- and lower jaw will remain
Note: Overpress parts exist for current teeth. Do you want to update them to fit to the possibly changed design?
In default mode requires moving mouse on surface while holding SHIFT+CTRL key (and is disabled during freeforming or placing).

Use the context menu to select desired function: • Right click on the background to edit all teeth. • Right click a tooth to edit individually (e.g. apply specific parameters to a single tooth) • CTRL+click to select multiple teeth (e.g. to apply specific parameters to a set of teeth)
You can also switch between modes by holding CTRL or SHIFT keys. Try it!

The changes you have made in expert mode prevent the wizard from going back to previous steps.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next step.
Segmentation was changed. You have to recalculate crown tops.
Segmentation not available. Please select more points.
You have not yet adapted pontics to gingiva
Under "Pontic", use "Adapt to gingiva". Otherwise, the resulting restoration may not fit on the model.
You have not yet adapted to the adjacents
Tip: Use "Delete constructed parts" to unlock more options
Tip: Switch to expert mode for more options
Calculate tool paths and start machining
Edit the final parts, e.g. by adding material or smoothing.
Close the wizard and switch to expert mode.
Close the wizard and keep merge parts.
Design finished. Files saved to project directory.
How do you want to proceed?
Ctrl + Right Click to deselect or select single teeth
You have not yet adjusted the occlusion to the antagonist
Paint moving, static or elastic parts
Save scene in project directory (Right-click for more options)
Show color map for intersections with antagonists or adjacents

When matching has completed, repeat with the next die.
Once all dies are matched, you can click 'Next' to continue.
Apply to all teeth. Hold CTRL or Shift and click on a tooth to select specific teeth.
Hold CTRL or Shift + Click on a tooth to select more teeth.
Do you want to continue anyway?

Sorry, you can't go back any further after loading a scene.
Tip: Switch to expert mode and use the context menu to jump to a specific step of the design process.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next step.
Optimize for Selective Laser Melting and 3D printing.
This mesh is not optimized for freeforming
Avoid freeforming near the connectors, as this may cause holes! To resolve this problem, save restorations again with the option "Optimize for better freeforming..." enabled.

Use Ctrl+Click to copy profile from previously selected point to clicked point. Use Ctrl+Shift+Click to copy profile selected point to all points Use Shift+Click to copy profile from previosuly selected point to all points between
There is no antagonist scan data

Please verify the result by inspecting the alignment of upper and lower jaw in the 3d viewer.
Press 'Next' if the alignment is correct.
To correct: - click on another point to restart matching, or - change rotation and click 'restart matching'

Sorry, the tooth could not be segmented.
To resolve the situation, please try the following:
- Correct the color selection manually. The tooth that will be segmented should be marked in red. The rest of the scan data (that is: the adjacents, gingiva, etc) should be marked in green. Click on the mesh (after selecting 'red' or 'green' using one of the two bucket icons) to help the software detect the correct area. To start over, click 'Undo all'.
- Correct the position of the margin. Switch to the 'Set Margin' tab and adjust the margin line (e.g. by adding more control points)
If you keep seeing this message, please also check that the scan data is correctly oriented, and free of holes/mesh errors/artefacts.
Best segmentation results are achieved by clicking the middle of the tooth.
First set points to define margin. Then click 'Apply'
The software has detected the tooth boundaries. You can improve the result by defining areas on the tooth. Use left click to mark and shift + left click to unmark areas.
Segmenting the tooth failed. Try to correct the marked area or readjust the margin.
Could not perform segmentation with given input and click point
I want to try again with different click point
I want to define the margin manually
There is already a selection. You can either keep it or generate a new selection from the margin.
Click on point of die scan, then click on same point on jaw scan.
Occlusion and approximal contacts were auto-adjusted
If you prefer to adjust occlusion manually, use 'Undo' to roll back automatic adjustments step by step.
This works anytime - even when the image loading dialog is closed.
You can also double-click the image to align it
Clears all clipped parts from the image.
You are loading an image collection in XML format

These files (*.treatmentImages) are exported from 3rd party software.
To load individual images, e.g. .JPG or .PNG files, use "Add 2D Image" from the "Tools" menu instead.
There is currently no online help for this processor
Opens pop up with image browser
Unable to take picture from camera.
Sorry, no compatible camera was found.
Opens webcam control to take a photo.
Closes the spline curve and divides the clipped part from the image.
Resizes the image by the desired distance with respect to to the measured distance.
Alings the selected image in position to the viewer.
Removes the selected image from the viewer.
Deletes the selected part from the image.
You can also click on the part of the image to change its visibility state.
This works only for the clipped parts, not the image itself.
Toggle the teeth that are affected by next tooth color change
Applies the selected color to the selected tooth parts.
Could not load the specified splitter.
Could not split Bridge with given Splitter location. Please move the Splitter and try again.
Note: Some parts are not finalized to be used as targets for attachments.
After merging for selective laser melting, all final reconstructions will be suitable as attachment targets.
The current freeform attachment had to be applied before closing, please check the results before continuing.
Apply current attachment onto target surface. Hint: Use Double-Click or Return-Key to do that instantly.
Unload currently placed attachment to restart on a different reconstruction or to hide it in normal freeforming. Hint: DELETE-Key has same effect.
Make sure that attachment geometry correctly intersects the desired target reconstruction. Try again after replacing it.
You can now place the same attachment on a different position, start over with different attachment, or press Replace button to change the target.
Error: Attachment mesh is not correct and cannot be used (check open edges in the original attachment library file).
Warning: A profile curve (e.g. for attachment, bar or bolts) could not be loaded.
Attachments are removed and bolts added to surface
Draw a spline on the surface!
There are still some attachment operations ongoing. Do you want to cancel them?
You can now draw a spline onto the design to generate a dynamic attachment/bolt guided by the spline and the surface
Warning: Use the attachment feature on your own risk!

Due to the enormous flexibility of the free attachment placement feature, the software cannot make any checks or guarantees regarding the producibility on the final result. Especially here, it is the user's responsibility to take care of correctness of the design results.

Once the attachment is placed by (mouse-click), you can move it by mouse. Hold SHIFT to move along insertion direction, Hold CTRL to rotate around insertion direction, Hold CTRL+SHIFT to rotate freely.
Once the attachment is placed (by mouse-click), you can rotate it by mouse. Hold CTRL to rotate freely (otherwise, it is around insertion direction)
You can select a pre-reduced tooth library here (e.g. for Mamelons), Note: When you work with pre-reduced tooth libraries, the normal shrinking functionality is disabled for these teeth.
You have reached the maximum number of custom views.

A custom view for the current viewing direction has been added.
You can reactivate this view direction by clicking on "Custom view
Please close wizard (go to expert mode) before executing this function.
The same function is already running in wizard.
Apply to all teeth. Hold CTRL or SHIFT and click on a tooth to select specific teeth.
Hold CTRL or SHIFT and click on tooth to select more.

The scan data orientation is unknown.
Rotate the model so that you look onto the occlusal side of the teeth, then click 'Set current view as axis' to define the orientation manually.
Not all meshs from the project definition could be loaded. You might not be able to finish your design as planned.
The main scan data mesh, which is required for this project, could not be loaded.

A waxup scan, which is required for this waxup-based project, could not be loaded.
If you choose 'Ignore', you need to manually load a waxup scan later on using the 'Add/remove mesh' feature.
You can open the CAD again once you have the necessary scan data
You will not be able to properly finish your design
Shape-preserving adaptation cannot be executed on Waxup teeth.
Please make sure to define the margin with ample space around the implant.

A problem occurred while processing scan data.
Either the orientation of the scan data is incorrect, or it contains mesh errors.
Tip: Please check that "Scan mode" is set correctly in the database module, and was not changed after the scan was performed.
Draw lines to mark areas you'd like to delete/crop.
Double-click to finish. Shift+double-click to unselect.
Distances to adjacents are being visualized.
Check if the scans are aligned correctly. Matching areas are shown in a brighter color.
No post-alignment done by software, i.e. input data must already have been aligned 100% correctly
The selected splitter is not valid for bridge split.
You must manually select the individual scan data files to load. Carefully look at the title of the 'Load' dialog, and select the correct file.
Estimated height of the design when its loaded into production software with its default axis.
Choose which teeth influence articulator movement
Directly design the part that fits on the abutment.
Please make sure to continue with same wizard step after loading this scene file to allow updating the final the design (e.g. ensure minimum thickness).
Some parts where not finalized (probably due to saving a scene directly during design) Please make sure to accept the current changes.
Please go back to the corresponding freeform step and allow software to finalize the design.
Not all waxup scan parts could be adapted. Usually this is not a problem and is related to non-connected superfluous scan data
Your system cannot be configured from inside this application. Please click on the help link for more information.
Warning: You may need to manually correct the waxup scan to remove any overlapping scan data!
The software feature "{0}" is still a prototype or beta version! It is currently only available for testing but NOT for productive or commercial use.
Continue at your own risk for testing only.
Use a suitable attachment geometry from custom file. Warning: Only very good geometry / topology files suitable for selective laser melting/3d printing work correctly here!
Rotate by adjusted scan data orientation.
Do you want to rotate the file to be aligned to the adjusted scan data orientation of this project?
Load file to scan data orientation?
The loaded file is an attachment library file or already matches this scan data orientation
The loaded file came from an external source for this project and shall exactly be aligned to it.
The clicked part has multiple separated geometry components. Do you want to use only the component that is connected to the clicked point, or the whole part?
Yes, use click point connected parts only.
Important: If you change the height of the parametrically designed attachment later on, re-do the alignment afterwards to ensure the position is correct!
Articulator prepared to adjust the lower jaw.
Articulator prepared to adjust the upper jaw.
Click coping near margin on left side to add a lingual band from left to right.
Click coping near margin on right side.
An user exception in native code occurred
Dear developer I can't convert you exception to unicode
Dear developer the number of parameters is wrong or the indexes in translation file
Keep only the selected part (delete UNSELECTED)
All small holes in the mesh were closed.
Articulator movement disabled in this step
Error: The selected attachment file is not suitable to be used as a design element.
Some parts do not fit into the premill abutments. Do you want to trim their shape automatically to fit into the premill blank?
The loaded model is not suitable because has invalid characteristics (e.g. holes, duplicate vertices, tunnels open edges).
Do you want to invert the surface orientation?
Error: An articulator mesh part could not be loaded.
Solitary vertices ( lost vertices without triangles )
Not a single shell ( e.g. holes or tunnels or separated components )
Open edges (e.g. holes or wrong triangles )
Bridge connector generation failed on teeth:
Do you want to block out the telescope after freeforming?
Error deleting a legacy or obsolete file.
Error merging a waxup or bar.
Please try to modify design near the implants, e.g. by freeforming or moving the teeth slightly.
Please try to modify the design, e.g. by freeforming or moving the teeth slightly.
Error: PDF Export is not supported on this system.
Error executing install action after addon package download
The input is not a valid number.
Please enter value in the range from {0} to {1}.
An implant library entry is missing in the local software installation
Error: An implant library entry is incomplete.
Error: An implant has invalid matrix.
Error writing to external nesting queue for material:
Use arrows to define insertion direction?
Error generating a virtual jaw imprint
Error, please set screw channel differently.
Do you really want to flip the axis
Error, could not use the directory
The current clip is not possible! Please adjust the shape of the curve so that it does not cross itself! You can do so by dragging the control points. Then try again.
Lingual bands on offset copings in wizard?
Please wait until the operation finishes
Do you want save your modifications to output files?
Tip: To change parameters for teeth individually, switch to expert mode.
Save is required because part still unsaved or different local production settings.
Out of memory error while creating high resolution screenshots. Please make sure to use a 64-bit software or select a lower resolution.
